User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.7) Gecko/20060909 Firefox/1.5.0.7 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.7) Gecko/20060909 Firefox/1.5.0.7 The home page opens a macromedia flash window and play advertisement for Hyundai Verna car. This despite selecting 'Block PopUp', Disable 'Load Images', Disable Java, and Disable Java Script. I have enclosed the code pieces from the page source for your reference. Please search for 'Hyundai',OR 'Verna' for the specific piece of code that brings up the popup. I Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.Open Firefox options and select 'Block popups', Disable Java, Disable Javascript, Disable load images. 2.Visit www.ndtv.com on 27 Sep 2006. This page may change on the next day. I have enclosed page source information in additional details. 3. Actual Results: The home page comes up and an ad pops up. The ad is for Hyundai Verna car. Can not close the popup window. Expected Results: Firefox should not allow the popup. Also, after selecting to close the popup window, firefox should close the popup window.
Close

comments.author: rflint@ryanflint.com
comments.raw_text: That's not a popup window. It's a div inserted over the main content and is a legitimate part of the page itself. If you want to close it, you'll need to reenable JavaScript.
